result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:30 pm 
INCLUDES 12CM1250, 13CM2144, AND 15CM621. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Keith Ellison.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 13CM2144: Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM621: Ct. 1 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 12CM1250: Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & defers entry of judgment. 
Atty Ellison makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: DEOJ for 2 years with conditions as outlined in written DEOJ agreement. 
State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ, it will move to amend the charge to County DC with $5 forfeiture plus costs. 
Review of DEOJ set for December 8, 2017 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA. 
Bond continues. 

Adj: 2:45 pm

Clerk Marisa.

INCLUDES 12CM1250, 13CM2144, AND 15CM621.

Date and time was set for motion hearing. 
State notes parties have reached resolution and request plea hearing be set before trial date to allow time for DEOJ agreement to be drafted. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set plea hearing before 12/14/2015.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-10-2015 02:30 pm

Case Called: 9:04 am 
INCLUDES 12CM1250, 13CM2144, AND 15CM621. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears by phone with Atty Keith Ellison. 
Date and time set for hearing to address MIL. 
COURT notes State's MIL apply only in 12CM1250 and defense's MIL apply in all 3 files. 

STATE'S MIL IN 12CM1250. 
COURT grants: #1 - as stated on the record, #2 - as stated on the record, #3, #5, #7, and #8 - as stated on record. 
COURT ORDERS compliance as it relates to #4. 
COURT notes #6 to be addressed day of trial. 
State notes #9 & #10 go to the defense's MIL. 
COURT holds #9 & #10 in abeyance. 

DEFENSE'S MIL. 
COURT questions Atty Ellison re: statutory authority for motion. 
COURT advises Atty Ellison to make motion more definite and certain before it will rule. 

COURT advises parties to see JA to set jury trial and motion hearing and mandates trial be set before the end of 2015. 
COURT advises deft to be physically present for any future hearings that are on the record. 
Bond Continues. 

Adj: 9:21 am
Motion hearing at 10-05-2015 09:00 am

Clerk Marisa.

COURT advises parties to see JA to set 1 hour motion hearing to address MIL.

COURT advises partes to file any JI 3 days before trial.

Case Called: 10:48am. INCLUDES 12CM1250, 13CM2144, 15CM621. Clerk: Denise. Reserve Judge Thomas Cane for Judge Lamont Jacobson. State appears by ADA Mike Puerner. Defendant appears prose. Matter set for 12CM1250 & 13CM2144 re: counsel for defendant. State recites history of matter - State has filed new charges in 15CM621. Crt proceeds with Initial Appearance 15CM621. Defendant in receipt of new complaint. Crt advises defendant rights to counsel. PLEA: NOT GUILTY by Court. Defendant states he made mutiple call ins regarding hearings to the Court and has gone to PD's office and has been denied counsel. Defendant files PD paperwork to the Court. Crt satisfied that he has is denied by PD's office. Crt proceeds with Indigency Hearing. Court questions Dft. RE: Employment/Income. Defendant makes statement. Court appts Atty Keith Ellison @ $70/hr not to exceed $1,000  w/o further order of the Court on all files. Wage Assignment:  to be determined by Payment Officer. State makes recommendation to Bond with conditons and Defendant makes statement re: conditons.  Arguments. COURT ORDERS Bond in 15CM621 Signature Bond $1,500; with Bond Condtions on all files: No contact with victim J.S. unless under Our Family Wizard website regarding well being of the child. DATES: PTC 4/20/15 @ 8:45am BR 3 in all files- Defendant must be available by phone. Adjourned:  11:03am.

Includes 15CM621, 12CM1250 and 13CM2144.  No contact wtih victim, J.S., unless under Our Family Wizard website regarding well being of the child.   Other contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
